summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Robert C. Petersen. The documents focus on local agency checks conducted by the FBI on Ivan Marti, Blanca Marti, and Manuel Marti in San Juan, Puerto Rico. These checks were conducted around October 1, 1968, and aimed to gather information on the Marti family. The documents do not provide any information related to Robert C. Petersen or his involvement in any events.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Robert C. Petersen has no apparent significance in the JFK context.
